page.title: 13RELIGION-WORSHIP.
page.content: Christianity is the main religion. There are a few Mormons and Shieks but no places of worship. The main branches of Christianity represented are Roman Catholics and Church of Scotland. There are 2 Roman Catholic Churches, St Lawrence's and St Mungo's and 5 Protestant Churches, 4 of them Church of Scotland. They are East Congregational, Cartsdyke, Mid Kirk, Wellpark East and the fifth is the Elim Church. All Christians believe in God and follow the teaching of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. They do not all worship in exactly the same way. The Church of Scotland is one of the Reformed Christian Churches and the established church in Scotland. There are many Roman Catholics in the area descendants of Irish immigrants, however there is little animosity and both sects get on very well.
